This is the MT starting position, although after some research I think the opening still has a couple of moves. At first glance it looks like white has an advantage.
moves.5... Bxc3+ 6. bxc3: I think this is the actual end of the Winawer variation of the opening, although I'm not positive.
moves.6... Qc7: Qc7 attacks c5, but I think black probably has his sights set on c3.
moves.7. Qg4: This seems like a good way to attack g7 and defend d4 at the same time.
moves.7... f5 8. Qh5+: Playing white, I considered Qh4, Qg3, and Qh5. Qh4 seemed to keep the defense on Qd4, but would give him an opportunity to develop the knight and prepare a castle. Qh5 forces a pawn advance. I still have the dark square bishop, he may not want to castle short. Analysis shows Qd1 (a move I really didn't consider) as the best one. I still think maybe Qg3 may have been better. Would value opinions on Qg3 versus Qd1.
moves.8... g6 9. Qh4: I really wish I would have thought through Qd1. It seemed like a retreat, but would have been better than this. My thought was to defend d4 first, then move Qg3 to defend the fork. At this point, I realize I should have moved to Qg3 earlier.
moves.9... cxd4 10. Qxd4 Nc6 11. Qa4: I underestimated the value of the e5 pawn and decided to leave it unprotected so I could pin the knight. I've been told I undervalue pawns and I am starting to understand this comment.
moves.11... Qxe5+ 12. Ne2: Down one now, but still trying to protect c3. Black now seems pretty well formed, while I have not determined how to diffuse the c3 pressure point. I noticed I don't really have a consistent strategy. I started out attacking king side, but the knight pin fractured that concept.
moves.12... Bd7: Black responds to the pin, and now I'm thinking about an exit strategy for my queen. However, I also know I have to do something about the black queen.
moves.13. Bf4: If he moved e4, I would almost have to exchange queens. I don't know how a queen exchange would play out. However, the exchange would double black's center pawns, so I thought he would retreat the queen.
moves.13... Qg7: Black obliges. However, now the reasoning I used for move 8. Qh5+ really showed up as flawed. He can easily castle kingside.
moves.14. Be3: I decided to focus on my strengths. I noticed black has a monopoly on white squares, but I have the dark squares. Not really sure what to do with this information, but the my dark bishop is important to me.
moves.14... Nf6 15. Nd4: I wasn't sure about this move because my queen is less mobile, but I really wanted to get more control of the center. Analysis indicates this is a mistake. In general, I think sometimes I play a bit too aggressive without considering the repercussions.
moves.15... O-O: The black castle seems to seal his defense tight. At this point, I'm uncomfortable with my earlier Nd4 move.
moves.16. Nxc6 Bxc6 17. Qd4 Ne4 18. Qxg7+: Even though I was down one, the queen trade seemed to be the best option. But now how to deal with the knight? I would like to get my king out of the middle sometime in the near future, but I don't see how when the attacks keep coming. The white bishop seems almost useless.
moves.18... Kxg7 19. c4: Trying to activate my white squared bishop.
moves.19... Ba4 20. Bd3: Those c pawns are really troublesome. Because I realized I was undervaluing my pawns earlier in the game, I think I have to defend it. I thought about Bd4, then advance the pawn, but moving Bd3 opens up for the castle.
moves.20... Rfc8 21. O-O-O: I intended on castling the other way, but thought somehow if I put my king behind the pawn it would be ok. I also thought having the rook at d1 would be strong support for the bishops somehow. Once I moved, I realized how bad this move was. His rooks are lining and the bishop is attacking that side already. I don't know why I moved my king into that mess.
moves.21... Kf7 22. f3: I can see the pawns are going to cause me problems, so I want to try and break them up.
moves.22... Nc3 23. g4: Yea, I have no idea why I didn't defend against the rook attack... it appears the wheels are coming off. Its all but over from here. I end up resigning. Thanks for the game Steven!
